channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Trump’s strategy to weaken the dollar could already be a success—in making it too expensive for Americans to travel to Europe
item.description: Virgin Atlantic, which made $1.3 billion from the U.S. last year, is seeing a decline in demand from Americans.

item.title: Hooters was dumped by its NASCAR team and sued for only hiring ‘Hooters Girls’ to serve customers. Now it’s filed for bankruptcy
item.description: Hooters, based in Atlanta, was founded in Clearwater, Florida, in 1983. Trouble had been brewing for a while.

item.title: France demands Volkswagen faces new trial over Dieselgate emissions—one of the biggest scandals to hit the auto industry
item.description: Volkswagen admitted in 2015 it had sold 11 million vehicles equipped with devices designed to cheat environmental regulations.

item.title: Demis Hassabis on Isomorphic’s $600 million raise, AI, and healthcare’s future
item.description: Demis Hassabis, cofounder of DeepMind and 2024 Nobel Laureate, talks to Fortune about his AI drug discovery startup, Isomorphic Labs.

item.title: President Trump wants action from the Fed, but one bank president says April 2 has only delayed their cuts
item.description: President of the Richmond Fed, Tom Barkin, hinted that confidence the FOMC needs to cut rates further has been hindered by President Trump's tariff po...

item.title: Airline stocks tumbled in March — why that matters for the economy
Intel’s new CEO asks customers for criticism and help in reviving the chip giant
Report of possible universal 20% tariff drags S&P 500 futures lower
In a rare move, Wall Street analysts get pointed in their criticism of RFK Jr.
Tesla sales dived 37% in France last month. It was even worse in Sweden.
